sect3.title: Program Files
sect3.para: agetty, arch, blockdev, cal, cfdisk, chkdupexe, col, colcrt, colrm, column, ctrlaltdel, cytune, ddate, dmesg, elvtune, fdformat, fdisk, fsck.minix, getopt, hexdump, hwclock, ipcrm, ipcs, isosize kill, line, logger, look, losetup, mcookie, mkfs, mkfs.bfs, mkfs.minix, mkswap, more, mount, namei, pivot_root, ramsize (link to rdev), raw, rdev, readprofile, rename, renice, rev, rootflags (link to rdev), script, setfdprm, setsid, setterm, sfdisk, swapoff (link to swapon), swapon, tunelp, ul, umount, vidmode, whereis and write

sect4.title: agetty
sect4.para: agetty opens a tty port, prompts for a login name and invokes the /bin/login command.

sect4.title: arch
sect4.para: arch prints the machine architecture.

sect4.title: blockdev
sect4.para: blockdev allows to call block device ioctls from the command line

sect4.title: cal
sect4.para: cal displays a simple calender.

sect4.title: cfdisk
sect4.para: cfdisk is an libncurses based disk partition table manipulator.

sect4.title: chkdupexe
sect4.para: chkdupexe finds duplicate executables.

sect4.title: col
sect4.para: col filters reverse line feeds from input.

sect4.title: colcrt
sect4.para: colcrt filters nroff output for CRT previewing.

sect4.title: colrm
sect4.para: colrm removes columns from a file.

sect4.title: column
sect4.para: column columnates lists.

sect4.title: ctrlaltdel
sect4.para: ctrlaltdel sets the function of the CTRL+ALT+DEL key combination (hard or soft reset).

sect4.title: cytune
sect4.para: cytune queries and modifies the interruption threshold for the Cyclades driver.

sect4.title: ddate
sect4.para: ddate converts Gregorian dates to Discordian dates.

sect4.title: dmesg
sect4.para: dmesg is used to examine or control the kernel ring buffer (boot messages from the kernel).

sect4.title: elvtune
sect4.para: elvtune allows to tune the I/O elevator per block device queue basis.

sect4.title: fdformat
sect4.para: fdformat low-level formats a floppy disk.

sect4.title: fdisk
sect4.para: fdisk is a disk partition table manipulator.

sect4.title: fsck.minix
sect4.para: fsck.minix performs a consistency check for the Linux MINIX filesystem.

sect4.title: getopt
sect4.para: getops parses command options the same way as the getopt C command.

sect4.title: hexdump
sect4.para: hexdump displays specified files, or standard input, in a user specified format (ascii, decimal, hexadecimal, octal).

sect4.title: hwclock
sect4.para: hwclock queries and sets the hardware clock (Also called the RTC or BIOS clock).

sect4.title: ipcrm
sect4.para: ipcrm removes a specified resource.

sect4.title: ipcs
sect4.para: ipcs provides information on IPC facilities.

sect4.title: isosize
sect4.para: isosize outputs the length of a iso9660 file system.

sect4.title: kill
sect4.para: kill sends a specified signal to the specified process.

sect4.title: line
sect4.para: line copies one line (up to a newline) from standard input and writes it to standard output.

sect4.title: logger
sect4.para: logger makes entries in the system log.

sect4.title: look
sect4.para: look displays lines beginning with a given string.

sect4.title: losetup
sect4.para: losetup sets up and controls loop devices.

sect4.title: mcookie
sect4.para: mcookie generates magic cookies for xauth.

sect4.title: mkfs
sect4.para: mkfs builds a Linux filesystem on a device, usually a harddisk partition.

sect4.title: mkfs.bfs
sect4.para: mkfs.bfs creates a SCO bfs file system on a device, usually a harddisk partition.

sect4.title: mkfs.minix
sect4.para: mkfs.minix creates a Linux MINIX filesystem on a device, usually a harddisk partition.

sect4.title: mkswap
sect4.para: mkswap sets up a Linux swap area on a device or in a file.

sect4.title: more
sect4.para: more is a filter for paging through text one screen full at a time.

sect4.title: mount
sect4.para: mount mounts a filesystem from a device to a directory (mount point).

sect4.title: namei
sect4.para: namei follows a pathname until a terminal point is found.

sect4.title: pivot_root
sect4.para: pivot_root moves the root file system of the current process.

sect4.title: ramsize
sect4.para: ramsize queries and sets RAM disk size.

sect4.title: raw
sect4.para: raw is used to bind a Linux raw character device to a block device.

sect4.title: rdev
sect4.para: rdev queries and sets image root device, swap device, RAM disk size, or video mode.

sect4.title: readprofile
sect4.para: readprofile reads kernel profiling information.

sect4.title: rename
sect4.para: rename renames files.

sect4.title: renice
sect4.para: renice alters priority of running processes.

sect4.title: rev
sect4.para: rev reverses lines of a file.

sect4.title: rootflags
sect4.para: rootflags queries and sets extra information used when mounting root.

sect4.title: script
sect4.para: script makes typescript of terminal session.

sect4.title: setfdprm
sect4.para: setfdprm sets user-provides floppy disk parameters.

sect4.title: setsid
sect4.para: setsid runs programs in a new session.

sect4.title: setterm
sect4.para: setterm sets terminal attributes.

sect4.title: sfdisk
sect4.para: sfdisk is a disk partition table manipulator.

sect4.title: swapoff
sect4.para: swapoff disables devices and files for paging and swapping.

sect4.title: swapon
sect4.para: swapon enables devices and files for paging and swapping.

sect4.title: tunelp
sect4.para: tunelp sets various parameters for the LP device.

sect4.title: ul
sect4.para: ul reads a file and translates occurrences of underscores to the sequence which indicates underlining for the terminal in use.

sect4.title: umount
sect4.para: umount unmounts a mounted filesystem.

sect4.title: vidmode
sect4.para: vidmode queries and sets the video mode.

sect4.title: whereis
sect4.para: whereis locates a binary, source and manual page for a command.

sect4.title: write
sect4.para: write sends a message to another user.
